channel.title: How do you compile a source and run the server on a MACINTOSH?
channel.description:
How do you compile a source and run the server on a MACINTOSH?
I see the awesome tuts on how to do it, but its all windows... Can anyone help me, or does no one seriously use Macs here...

item.source: How do you compile a source and run the server on a MACINTOSH?

item.title: How do you compile a source and run the server on a MACINTOSH?
item.dc:creator: @Sleep Sleep
item.description:
@Sleep wrote:

Well of course, that is just IP redirection with all the bells and whistles.

The reason I can’t host my server on my MacBook [Which has 8gB of RAM and 2.5ghZ] is because the runserver.bat is a DOS command. Like I said before it won’t run, it will ask you what program would you like to use to open this file type with.

Although you can dual boot with Mac -> Windows… Meaning that you’ll boot with OSX then it’ll run in native XP environment, but that’s just Windows again, so therefore making it useless…

Unless you can compile with OSX and run a server with OSX, which is literally impossible.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you compile a source and run the server on a MACINTOSH?
